intro: Angoseseli, commonly known as the Andean bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Andes Mountains. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in cool and moist conditions. Its leaves are usually narrow and grass-like, while its stems are sturdy and upright. Angoseseli plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, providing nectar for pollinators and contributing to the biodiversity of high-altitude ecosystems.
